channel.description: Recent content in cards/statistics/nml.md on Datumorphism

item.title: Fisher Information Approximation
item.description: FIA is a method to describe the minimum description length ( MDL MDL is a measure of how well a model compresses data ) of models, $$ \mathrm{FIA} = -\ln p(y | \hat\theta) + \frac{k}{2} \ln \frac{n}{2\pi} + \ln \int_\Theta \sqrt{ \operatorname{det}[I(\theta)] d\theta } $$ $I(\theta)$: Fisher information matrix of sample size 1. $$I_{i,j}(\theta) = E\left( \frac{\partial \ln p(y| \theta)}{\partial \theta_i}\frac{ \partial \ln p (y | \theta) }{ \partial \theta_j } \right)$$.

item.title: Minimum Description Length
item.description: The minimum description length, aka, MDL, is based on the idea of data compression. MDL looks for the model that compresses the data well. To compress data, we need to find the regularity in the data. There are many versions of MDL. crude two-part code Fisher information approximation ( FIA FIA is a method to describe the minimum description length ( MDL MDL is a measure of how well a model compresses data ) of models, $$ \mathrm{FIA} = -\ln p(y | \hat\theta) + \frac{k}{2} \ln \frac{n}{2\pi} + \ln \int_\Theta \sqrt{ \operatorname{det}[I(\theta)] d\theta } $$ $I(\theta)$: Fisher information matrix of sample size 1.
